content.description: The top of the route is just North (along the AT) of the Tom Leonard Shelter. The route starts on top of a small fallen boulder and follows the flakes until they run out. When the flake runs out, the crux starts. Use 2 small crimps to the left and a high right foot to reach a good right hand sidepull, then traverse right to the next good quartz covered crack system. There are good holds to the ledge and the end of the climb. Enjoy!
content.location: Just north of Tom Leonard Shelter along the AT (coming from the shelter), cross the stream, and go up the hill. Once you are at the top of the hill on the other side of the stream, the top of the climb is located directly to your right. The top of the climb is 10' to the left of the very tall tree coming up from the bottom of the ice gulch.

content.description: The Ice Glutch is just north of the Tom Leonard Shelter.
